meanings.definition: To act in anticipation of a future event.
meanings.sent1: She preacts by studying ahead of time for her exams.
meanings.sent2: He always preacts by packing his bag the night before a trip.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preacts by gathering extra nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl preacts by sharpening its talons before hunting.
meanings.sent5: Preacting can help avoid last-minute stress and panic.

meanings.definition: Actions taken before an event occurs.
meanings.sent1: The preacts of preparation made the event run smoothly.
meanings.sent2: Her preacts included setting up the decorations early.
meanings.sent3: The preacts of the chef involved prepping ingredients in advance.
meanings.sent4: The preacts of the team ensured they were ready for the competition.
meanings.sent5: Effective preacts can save time and prevent problems later on.
